      Encrypt method that takes in an byte array that is the message, as well as the public sequence, then for each byte in the message, computes each bit in the byte, then adds the corresponding number in the public sequence to the encrypted message.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        main method to test and utilize all methods defined in this document.
        Parameters:

      • split

        public static byte[][] split​(java.lang.String filename,
                             int sequence_length)
        This method takes in the name of a file, as well as a length. This effectively splits up the message into blocks of bytes of the length provided. This length should not be the length of the private sequence, but rather, (1/8)*(length of private sequence), since each byte will take up eight digits of the sequence.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file where the message is being stored
        sequence_length - the length of the blocks
        Returns:
        a double byte array containing the blocks of the message.

      • privateSequence

        public static java.math.BigInteger[] privateSequence​(int length,
                                                     int start_length)
        This method returns a superincreasing sequence with a given length, where the first number has at most a given number of bits. This method first checks to ensure that the length of the sequence is a multiple of 8, so that it works with the encrypt method.
        Parameters:
        length - The number of terms to be in the sequence
        start_length - The maximum number of bits for the first number in the sequence
        Returns:
        The superincreasing sequence

      • encrypt

        public static java.math.BigInteger encrypt​(byte[] message,
                                           java.math.BigInteger[] publicSequence)
        Encrypt method that takes in an byte array that is the message, as well as the public sequence, then for each byte in the message, computes each bit in the byte, then adds the corresponding number in the public sequence to the encrypted message. Note that this method requires that the length of the publicSequence must be an integer multiple of 8. Which is guaranteed by the privateSequence method.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be encrypted
        publicSequence - The public sequence to be used for encryption
        Returns:
        The number that corresponds to the encrypted block

      • decrypt

        public static int[] decrypt​(java.math.BigInteger message,
                            java.math.BigInteger[] privateSequence,
                            java.math.BigInteger multiplier,
                            java.math.BigInteger modulus)
        Takes a sigle block of an encrypted message, and decrypts it, by using the private sequence that is provided, to solve the Knapsack problem of finding the original bits of the message. This method retuns a int array that will contain the original message. This method does not return a byte[] becuase of sign issues. The fact that this method returns an int array means that to write the decrypted message to a file, we cannot use the write(byte[]) method of the FileOutputStream, but we have to use the write(int b) method of the FileOutputStream.
        Parameters:
        message - the BigInteger corresponding to the encrypted block
        privateSequence - The private sequence
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the original message

      • toByte

        public static int toByte​(boolean[] array)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        helper method that takes a boolean array and turns in into an integer. This is used by the decrypt method to turn binary representations of messages into integers that can be written into a file.
        Parameters:
        array - the array to convert into an integer
        Returns:
        the integer represented by the array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of the boolean array is not 8.

      • publicSequence

        public static java.math.BigInteger[] publicSequence​(java.math.BigInteger[] privateSequence,
                                                    java.math.BigInteger modulus,
                                                    java.math.BigInteger multiplier)
        Takes a private sequence and uses the given multiplier and modulus to convert it into a public sequence, if the multiplier is chosen well, then this will hide the details of the private sequence, so the encrypted message created with this public sequence is secure.
        Parameters:
        privateSequence - The private sequence to be kept secret
        modulus - The modulus
        multiplier - The multiplier to use.
        Returns:
        The public sequence to be published.

        Parameters:
        array - The array to be printed.
